item.title: arXiv: optimising hadronic collider simulations using amplitude neural networks
item.description: The preprint for my ACAT2021 proceedings contribution, Optimising hadronic collider simulations using amplitude neural networks, appeared on arXiv today. This follows my recent talk. It is also available through the GitLab CI system here (source).

item.title: Phys. Let. B: NLO gluon fusion to diphoton plus jet cross sections
item.description: Following the arXiv release, the open access version of our paper Next-to-leading order QCD corrections to diphoton-plus-jet production through gluon fusion at the LHC was published online in Physics Letters B today.

item.title: ACAT 2021 talk: optimising simulations for diphoton production at hadron colliders using amplitude neural networks
item.description: I gave a virtual talk at ACAT2021 (while I had COVID, actually) about our recent paper. Here are the slides (source) and a recording (below). Apologies for where the audio cuts out in the middle, but it’s really Zoom’s fault for not supporting Linux well.

item.title: JHEP: gluon fusion to diphoton plus jet amplitude at two loops
item.description: Following the arXiv release, our paper Virtual QCD corrections to gluon-initiated diphoton plus jet production at hadron colliders was published by the Journal of High Energy Physics today.

item.title: arXiv: NLO gluon fusion to diphoton plus jet cross sections
item.description: In our preprint appearing on arXiv today, Next-to-leading order QCD corrections to diphoton-plus-jet production through gluon fusion at the LHC, we use the two-loop amplitudes from Virtual QCD corrections to gluon-initiated diphoton plus jet production at hadron colliders along with the real corrections to obtain differential cross sections of gluon-initiated diphoton-plus-jet production at NLO.

item.title: arXiv: gluon fusion to diphoton plus jet amplitude at two loops
item.description: Today the preprint of our article Virtual QCD corrections to gluon-initiated diphoton plus jet production at hadron colliders appeared on arXiv, in which we compute the two-loop gluon fusion to diphoton plus jet amplitude, providing it ready for phenomenological application in an accompanying NJet release.

item.title: YTF20: introduction to precision QCD
item.description: I was on the committee for the YTF 2019 and YTF 2020 conferences. For YTF20, I also gave a non-specialist talk on precision QCD. The talk is recorded (see below) and the slides are available here (source) (discussion of tech).

item.title: Continuous symmetries in dual-mode Dicke models
item.description: My final-year undergraduate research project, supervised by Jonathan Keeling and Kyle Ballantine, involved modelling non-equilibrium quantum systems to explore the continuous symmetries they can exhibit. Before starting original work, I conducted a literature review, summarised in my report (source). I then developed a Python simulation of the two-mode Dicke model to study its quantum phases. I wrote up the project in my dissertation (source). I also presented a poster (source) and defended the work in my viva with a presentation (source).

item.title: Polarisation in photon Bose-Einstein condensation
item.description: My second summer research project was with Jonathan Keeling and Peter Kirton, modelling the polarisation behaviour of a Bose-Einstein condensate of photons. I wrote a Python code to simulate the system for this study. I reported (source) and presented a poster (source) on the work at the end of the summer. In the next academic term, I gave a presentation (source) to fellow undergraduates in my department. I also continued work on the project, leading to a paper (arXiv).
